intro: Convolvulus varius, commonly known as the variable morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often opening in the morning. Its flowers are typically 2–4 cm in diameter and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Convolvulus varius is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
